reasons_to_visit.details: Traditional Czech Christmas markets in the Great Square feature handcrafted ornaments, local treats, and warm mulled wine (svařené víno).
Snow-covered historic architecture, especially the White Tower and Holy Spirit Cathedral, creates a magical winter atmosphere.
Perfect time to visit the East Bohemian Museum, Klicper Theatre, and warm cafés while enjoying traditional Czech Christmas atmosphere.
Experience genuine Czech Christmas traditions, including traditional Christmas markets and local holiday celebrations.
December builds to festive New Year's Eve celebrations with fireworks and local festivities in the Great Square.

reasons_to_avoid.details: December temperatures often drop below freezing (-2 to 4°C), requiring heavy winter clothing and preparation for snow.
Shortest days of the year with only 8 hours of daylight, limiting outdoor sightseeing opportunities.
Some attractions and restaurants may have limited hours during Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day.
Christmas and New Year's periods see increased prices for accommodations and dining, though still more affordable than Prague.

activities: Christmas market shopping in Great Square
Indoor café culture with warm drinks

local_tips: Visit Christmas markets early morning for fewer crowds and better selection
Dress warmly and wear proper winter footwear for snow and ice
Book restaurants in advance, especially for Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve
Visit indoor attractions like the East Bohemian Museum during cold weather
Enjoy traditional Czech Christmas treats like vánočka (Christmas bread) and mulled wine
Check opening hours for attractions during Christmas holidays
Take advantage of shorter days for cozy indoor cultural experiences
